citeinfo.title: BEDROCK_GEOLOGY_RGM_250K_IN: Bedrock geology of Indiana, from the Regional Geologic Map Series of the Indiana Geological Survey (Indiana Geological Survey, 1:250,000, Polygon Shapefile)
citeinfo.othercit:
This shapefile was derived and modified from a series of preexisting published paper maps. Additional attributes were included from derivative products of the "Compendium of Paleozoic rock-unit stratigraphy in Indiana—a revision: Indiana Geological Survey Bulletin 59 (1986)." The names of some groups, formations, and members on some of the maps have been updated to reflect the most recent nomenclature.
Gray, H.H., Bleuer, N.K., Hill, J.R., and Lineback, J.A., 1979, Geologic map of the 1° x 2° Indianapolis quadrangle, Indiana and Illinois, showing bedrock and unconsolidated deposits: Indiana Geological Survey Regional Geologic Map No. 1, Indianapolis Sheet, Part A (RGM1A).
Wayne, W.J., Johnson, G.H., and Keller, S.J., 1966, Geologic map of the 1° x 2° Danville quadrangle, Indiana and Illinois, showing bedrock and unconsolidated deposits: Indiana Geological Survey Regional Geologic Map No. 2, Vincennes Sheet, Part A (RGM2A).
Gray, H.H., Wayne, W.J., and Wier, C.E., 1970, Geologic map of the 1° x 2° Vincennes quadrangle and Parts of Adjoining Quadrangles, Indiana and Illinois, showing bedrock and unconsolidated deposits: Indiana Geological Survey Regional Geologic Map No. 3, Vincennes Sheet, Part A (RGM3A).
Schneider, A.F., and Keller, S.J., 1970, Geologic map of the 1° x 2° Chicago quadrangle, Indiana, Illinois, and Michigan, showing bedrock and unconsolidated deposits: Indiana Geological Survey Regional Geologic Map No. 4, Chicago Sheet, Part A (RGM4A).
Burger, A.M., Forsyth, J.L., Nicoll, R.S., and Wayne, W.J., 1971, Geologic map of the 1° x 2° Muncie quadrangle, Indiana and Ohio, showing bedrock and unconsolidated deposits: Indiana Geological Survey Regional Geologic Map No. 5, Muncie Sheet, Part A (RGM5A).
Gray, H.H., 1972, Geologic map of the 1° x 2° Louisville quadrangle, Indiana, showing bedrock and unconsolidated deposits: Indiana Geological Survey Regional Geologic Map No. 6, Louisville Sheet, Part A (RGM6A).
Gray, H.H., Forsyth, J.L., Schneider, A.F., and Gooding, A.M., 1972, Geologic map of the 1° x 2° Cincinnati quadrangle, Indiana and Ohio, showing bedrock and unconsolidated deposits: Indiana Geological Survey Regional Geologic Map No. 7, Cincinnati Sheet, Part A (RGM7A).
Johnson, G.H., and Keller, S.J., 1972, Geologic map of the 1° x 2° Fort Wayne quadrangle, Indiana, Michigan, and Ohio, showing bedrock and unconsolidated deposits: Indiana Geological Survey Regional Geologic Map No. 8, Fort Wayne Sheet, Part A (RGM8A).

descript.abstract: BEDROCK_GEOL_RGM_IN is a polygon shapefile that shows the bedrock geology of the state of Indiana, produced from the Indiana Geological Survey Regional Geologic Map series, which was mapped at a scale of 1:250,000. The mapped stratigraphic units include selected systems, groups, and formations. Additional attributes were included from derivative products of the "Compendium of Paleozoic rock-unit stratigraphy in Indiana—a revision: Indiana Geological Survey Bulletin 59 (1986)." The names of some groups, formations, and members on some of the maps have been updated to reflect the most recent nomenclature.
descript.purpose: BEDROCK_GEOL_RGM_IN was created to provide a seamless statewide coverage of the bedrock geology of the state of Indiana, suitable for use in a GIS, from the IGS Regional Geologic Map series of preexisting published paper maps (eight maps in total). The mapped stratigraphic units include selected systems, groups, and formations. The mapping represents the state of knowledge of bedrock geology in Indiana at the time of publication.

idinfo.native: ESRI ArcGIS (v 10.0) shapefile format, Microsoft Windows 7 Enterprise, Approximately 18.7 Mb

attracc.attraccr:
BEDROCK_GEOLOGY_RGM_250K_IN contains attributes with designations that refer to various bedrock stratigraphic units. The designations are the same as those appearing on the published maps from which the shapefile was derived, with the following exception: within the field named "Unit," the value of "S" from RGM7 is "S1"; the value of "O" from RGM7 is "O2"; the value of "S" and "V" for the Springfield Coal Member is "PS"; the value of "K" for the Kope Formation is "OK"; the value of "D" for the Dillsboro Formation is "OD"; the value of "W" for the Waldron Formation is "SW"; the value of "LC" for the Liston Creek Member is "SLC"; the value of "M" for the Mississinewa Member is "SM"; the value of "O2" from RGM6 is "O"; the value of "LB" for the Lower Block Member is "PLB"; the value of "WF" for the West Franklin Member is "PWF"; the value of "B" for the Buffaloville Member is "PB."
Two tests for attribute consistency were performed by IGS personnel:
(1) Values of each field were checked for completeness and validity, using the Select by Attributes Tool in ESRI ArcGIS:
(a) Completeness of values was verified. All attribute values in the shapefile were confirmed to be present on the paper source map. No values were left blank, unless appropriate.
(b) Validity of values was verified. All values were checked for spelling and capitalization.
(c) Relationships between fields were verified.
(2) Using ESRI ArcGIS, the attributes of the shapefile were visually compared with a paper copy of the published source map. Such a comparison was made for every polygon.
The following notes are excerpted directly from the published source maps:
Gray et al., 1979 (RGM1A): “Completely revised from: C. E. Wier and H. H. Gray, 1961, Geologic map of the 1° X 2° Indianapolis quadrangle. Geology compiled by H. H. Gray (Indiana) and J. A. Lineback (Illinois) from published and original sources, mainly: in Indiana, N. K. Bleuer, H. H. Gray, J. R. Hill, H. C. Hutchinson, and C. E. Wier; in Illinois, K. E. Clegg, J. C. Frye, J. A. Simon, and H. B. Willman. Prepared for publication by H. H. Gray. Drafted by R. L. Purcell.”
Wayne et al., 1966 (RGM2A): “Geology compiled from original data by Elwood Atherton, G. K. Ekblaw, J. A. Simon, and H. B. Willman (Illinois State Geological Survey); D. L. Ballmann and M. E. Davis (St. Joseph's College and Indiana Geological Survey); G. H. Johnson, S. J. Keller, and W. J. Wayne (Indiana Geological Survey); and from the following sources: Hutchison, 1961 (Fountain, Warren, and Vermillion Counties); Rosenschein, 1958 (Tippecanoe County); Thornbury and Deane, 1955 (Miami County); Pinsak and Shaver, 1964 (Silurian rocks); Thornbury, in prep. (Tippecanoe County); published soil maps of Carroll, Cass, Fulton, Miami, Newton, and Vermillion Counties; and unpublished soil maps of parts of Fountain, Howard, Jasper, Pulaski, and White Counties. Drafted by J. E. Peace and R. E. Judah.”
Gray et al., 1970 (RGM3A): “Geology by H. H. Gray, W. J. Wayne, and C. E. Wier (Indiana) and K. E. Clegg and H. B. Willman (Illinois). Drafted by J. R. Tolen.”
Schneider et al., 1970 (RGM4A): “Geology compiled from original data by J. A. Lineback and H. B. Willman (Illinois State Geological Survey); M. E. Davis (St. Joseph's College and Indiana Geological Survey); Mark Reshkin (Indiana University and Indiana Geological Survey); G. H. Johnson, S. J. Keller, and A. F. Schneider (Indiana Geological Survey); G. D. Ells and F. W. Terwilliger (Michigan Geological Survey); and from the following sources: Bretz, 1939, 1943, 1955 (Chicago area, Illinois); Leighton and Willman, 1953 (Pleistocene deposits of northeastern Illinois); Pinsak and Shaver, 1964 (Salina Formation); Bulletins of the Indiana Division of Water on ground-water resources of northwestern Indiana (preliminary reports) prepared by the U.S. Geological Survey (subsurface data); published soil maps of Fulton, Kosciusko, Lake, LaPorte, Newton, Porter, St. Joseph, and Starke Counties, Indiana, and Berrien County, Michigan; and unpublished soil maps of parts of Elkhart and Marshall Counties, Indiana. Compilation of bedrock geology coordinated and edited by S. J. Keller and of unconsolidated deposits by A. F. Schneider; index maps show areas of primary mapping responsibility. Drafted by R. L. Purcell."
Burger et al., 1971 (RGM5A): “Geology compiled from original and published data. Bedrock geology compiled by A. M. Burger (Indiana Geological Survey and Smith College). Surficial geology compiled by J. L. Forsyth (Bowling Green State University); G. H. Johnson (Indiana Geological Survey and College of William and Mary); R. S. Nicoll (Indiana Geological Survey and University of Iowa); Mark Reshkin (Indiana Geological Survey and Indiana University-Northwest); and W. J. Wayne (Indiana Geological Survey and University of Nebraska). Drafted by Roger L. Purcell."
Gray, 1972 (RGM6A): "Geology from published sources and from field work by G. D. Brown, Jr., J. P. Ford, R. R. French, H. H. Gray, A. M. Jacobs, J. A. Lineback, C. B. Rexroad, J. A. Sunderman, and W. J. Wayne. Compiled by H. H. Gray and A. M. Burger. Drafted by J. R. Tolen."
Gray et al., 1972 (RGM7A): "Compiled by Henry H. Gray, Jane L. Forsyth, and Ann M. Burger from published and original sources, principally: in Indiana, G. D. Brown, Jr., J. P. Ford, R. R. French, A. M. Gooding, H. H. Gray, W. Harrison, A. M. Jacobs, J. A. Lineback, A. F. Schneider, J. A. Sunderman, and W. J. Wayne; in Ohio, W. P. Cross, R. H. Durrell, J. P. Ford, J. L. Forsyth, R. P. Goldthwait, J. J. Kohut, R. H. Osborne, and S. E. Norris. Prepared for publication by H. H. Gray. Drafted by R. L. Purcell."
Johnson and Keller, 1972 (RGM8A): "Geology compiled from original data by J. L. Forsyth (Bowling Green State University and Ohio Geological Survey), F. W. Terwilliger and G. D. Ells (Michigan Geological Survey); Mark Reshkin (Indiana University and Indiana Geological Survey); S. J. Keller (Indiana Geological Survey); G. H. Johnson (College of William and Mary and Indiana Geological Survey); and from the following sources: Martin, 1955, 1957, 1958, (Pleistocene deposits of southern Michigan); Wayne and Thornbury, 1951 (Wabash County); Pinsak and Shaver, 1964 (Salina Formation); published soil maps of Allen, Fulton, Kosciusko, Noble, and Steuben Counties, Indiana, and Branch, Cass, Hillsdale, Lenawee, and St. Joseph Counties, Michigan; and unpublished soil maps of parts of De Kalb, Elkhart, Lagrange, and Whitley Counties, Indiana. Compilation of bedrock geology coordinated and edited by S. J. Keller and of unconsolidated deposits by G. H. Johnson. Index maps show areas of primary mapping responsibility. Drafted by R. L. Purcell and J. R. Tolen."

dataqual.logic: The ESRI ArcGIS polygon data structure constitutes the shapefile format for these data.
dataqual.complete: BEDROCK_GEOLOGY_RGM_250K_IN.SHP was derived with minor modifications from preexisting published paper maps and is assumed to embody the same definitions and generalizations as were used in the creation of the published maps.

horizpa.horizpar:
No records exist regarding horizontal positional accuracy of this shapefile. The coordinates used in georeferencing the paper maps from which BEDROCK_GEOLOGY_RGM_250K_IN.SHP was generated were derived with the same accuracy (1:250,000 scale) as the geologic polygons. No quantitative tests were performed.
The following notes appear on the published source maps:
Gray et al., 1979 (RGM1A): "Base compiled in 1976 from U.S.G.S. 7.5 minute quadrangle maps."
Wayne et al., 1966 (RGM2A): "Base modified from Army Map Service, Map NK 16-11, 1958."
Gray et al., 1970 (RGM3A): "Base modified from Army Map Service Maps NJ 16-4, NJ 16-5, NJ 16-7, and NJ 16-8, 1954-61."
Schneider and Keller, 1970 (RGM4A): "Base modified from Army Map Service, Map NK 16-8, 1953."
Burger et al., 1971 (RGM5a): "Base modified from Army Map Service, Map NK 16-12, 1956."
Gray, 1972 (RGM6a): "Base modified from Army Map Service Map NJ16-6, 1964."
Gray et al., 1972 (RGM7a): "Base modified from Army Map Service, Map NJ 16-3, 1964."
Johnson and Keller, 1972 (RGM8a): "Base modified from Army Map Service, Map NK 16-9, 1962."

vertacc.vertaccr: Vertical positional accuracy was not a factor in the digital production of BEDROCK_GEOLOGY_RGM_250K_IN.SHP.

citeinfo.title: Regional Geologic Bedrock Maps of Indiana (8 in total)

srcinfo.srccitea: Indiana Geological Survey Regional Geologic Map Series
srcinfo.srccontr:
The attributes of BEDROCK_GEOLOGY_RGM_250K_IN.SHP were derived by transcribing the attributes of the source paper maps.
Gray, H.H., Bleuer, N.K., Hill, J.R., and Lineback, J.A., 1979, Geologic map of the 1° x 2° Indianapolis quadrangle, Indiana and Illinois, showing bedrock and unconsolidated deposits: Indiana Geological Survey Regional Geologic Map No. 1, Indianapolis Sheet, Part A (RGM1A).
Wayne, W.J., Johnson, G.H., and Keller, S.J., 1966, Geologic map of the 1° x 2° Danville quadrangle, Indiana and Illinois, showing bedrock and unconsolidated deposits: Indiana Geological Survey Regional Geologic Map No. 2, Vincennes Sheet, Part A (RGM2A).
Gray, H.H., Wayne, W.J., and Wier, C.E., 1970, Geologic map of the 1° x 2° Vincennes quadrangle and parts of adjoining quadrangles, Indiana and Illinois, showing bedrock and unconsolidated deposits: Indiana Geological Survey Regional Geologic Map No. 3, Vincennes Sheet, Part A (RGM3A).
Schneider, A.F., and Keller, S.J., 1970, Geologic map of the 1° x 2° Chicago quadrangle, Indiana, Illinois, and Michigan, showing bedrock and unconsolidated deposits: Indiana Geological Survey Regional Geologic Map No. 4, Chicago Sheet, Part A (RGM4A).
Burger, A.M., Forsyth, J.L., Nicoll, R.S., and Wayne, W.J., 1971, Geologic map of the 1° x 2° Muncie quadrangle, Indiana and Ohio, showing bedrock and unconsolidated deposits: Indiana Geological Survey Regional Geologic Map No. 5, Muncie Sheet, Part A (RGM5A).
Gray, H.H., 1972, Geologic map of the 1° x 2° Louisville quadrangle, Indiana, showing bedrock and unconsolidated deposits: Indiana Geological Survey Regional Geologic Map No. 6, Louisville Sheet, Part A (RGM6A).
Gray, H.H., Forsyth, J.L., Schneider, A.F., and Gooding, A.M., 1972, Geologic map of the 1° x 2° Cincinnati quadrangle, Indiana and Ohio, showing bedrock and unconsolidated deposits: Indiana Geological Survey Regional Geologic Map No. 7, Cincinnati Sheet, Part A (RGM7A).
Johnson, G.H., and Keller, S.J., 1972, Geologic map of the 1° x 2° Fort Wayne quadrangle, Indiana, Michigan, and Ohio, showing bedrock and unconsolidated deposits: Indiana Geological Survey Regional Geologic Map No. 8, Fort Wayne Sheet, Part A (RGM8A).

citeinfo.title: Compendium of Paleozoic rock-unit stratigraphy in Indiana—a revision: Indiana Geological Survey Bulletin 59

srcinfo.srccontr: A 203-page report that details the more important time and rock stratigraphy used in Indiana.

procstep.procdesc: Paper versions of the Indiana Geological Survey's Regional Geologic Map Series (RGM) were scanned to full-color TIFF images by IGS personnel using a wide-bed scanner. To accentuate the geologic contacts and deemphasize map colors and non-geologic labels, each image was then opened in Adobe Photoshop and adjustments to the color saturation and contrast were made. Next, the images were converted to black and white. The black and white images were then opened in ESRI ArcMap and georeferenced to Universal Transverse Mercator (UTM), Zone 16, NAD83 coordinate system and datum, using LANDSURVEY_SECTIONS_LINE_IN.SHP as the base map. The rectified black and white images were then viewed transparently with the original color image in the background to serve as a reference. The "Raster Paintbrush" tool was then used to erase black pixels that did not represent a geologic contacts and to add contacts where gaps existed. Next, in "Raster Cleanup" (ArcScan toolbar), the "dilation" setting was used to thicken the geologic contacts, and settings for "Gap Closure Tolerance" were adjusted to connect broken or uncertain contacts. The "Vectorization" tool was then used to convert the black and white rasters into polylines for each of the eight RGM maps. Attributes were then assigned using the same stratigraphic designations that appear on the original RGM maps. The attributed polygon shapefiles were then merged together to create a seamless statwide polygon shapefile named BEDROCK_GEOLOGY_RGM_250K_IN.SHP. Some geologic contacts across edge boundaries had to be interpreted to create a seamless merged polygon shapefile. Also, in some cases, only the base or top of a formation or member was mapped. For these units, the mapped contact was digitized as a polyline and a 1-meter buffer was added to both sides of the line to produce a polygon.
procstep.srcused: Indiana Geological Survey Regional Geologic Map (RGM) series 1 through 8

procstep.procdesc: BEDROCK_GEOLOGY_RGM_250K_IN.SHP was opened in ESRI ArcMap and attribute fields named "Unit," "Name," "Ages," "Rank," "AgeRank," "Lithology," "Lith_other," "Epochs," "Group," "Formations," "Members," and "Source" were added. Values were populated with information contained in the legends of the Regional Geologic Maps and from the IGS publication named "Compendium of Paleozoic Rock-Unit Stratigraphy in Indiana" (1986).

This metadata was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit) and MP (Metadata Parser) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (United States Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected, except that no values were assigned to "Abscissa_Resolution" and "Ordinate_Resolution."

attr.attrdef: The coded abbreviation name of the geologic unit
attr.attrdefs: IGS Regional Geologic Map Series 1-8; IGS Bulletin 59
IGS Regional Geologic Map Series 1-8; IGS Bulletin 59

attr.attrdef: The name of the geologic time period(s) associated with each geologic unit
attr.attrdefs: IGS Regional Geologic Map Series 1-8; IGS Bulletin 59

attr.attrdef: Rank of unit associated with "Name" field (member, formation, group). In cases where the unit represents only a geologic contact, the position of the contact ("base" or "top") is noted in parentheses.
attr.attrdefs: IGS Regional Geologic Map Series 1-8; IGS Bulletin 59

edom.edomvd: A fundamental unit of lithostratigraphy, representing distinct geologic layers of a formation. A formation is not always divided into members unless a useful purpose exists. Formations may have only certain parts designated as members.
A fundamental unit of lithostratigraphy, consisting of a certain number of rock strata that have a comparable lithology, facies, or other similar properties.
A fundamental unit of lithostratigraphy, usually consisting of two or more contiguous or associated formations with significant and diagnostic lithologic properties in common.

attr.attrdef: An index number used to stratigraphically rank the identified geologic units in Indiana.
attr.attrdefs: IGS Regional Geologic Map Series 1-8; Center for Geospatial Data Analysis

attr.attrdef: A description of the dominant lithology associated with the geologic unit.
attr.attrdefs: IGS Regional Geologic Map Series 1-8; IGS Bulletin 59

attr.attrdef: A description of the secondary lithology or lithologies associated with the geologic unit.
attr.attrdefs: IGS Regional Geologic Map Series 1-8; IGS Bulletin 59

attr.attrdef: Name of the dominant Epoch associated with each geologic unit.
attr.attrdefs: IGS Regional Geologic Map Series 1-8; IGS Bulletin 59

attr.attrdef: Group name associated with with the geologic unit.
attr.attrdefs: IGS Regional Geologic Map Series 1-8; IGS Bulletin 59

attr.attrdef: Formation name(s) associated with the geologic unit.
attr.attrdefs: IGS Regional Geologic Map Series 1-8; IGS Bulletin 59

attr.attrdef: Member name(s) associated with the geologic unit.
attr.attrdefs: IGS Regional Geologic Map Series 1-8; IGS Bulletin 59

attr.attrdef: A list of the source maps (RGMs) that reference the geologic unit.

distinfo.distliab:
It is requested that the Indiana Geological Survey be cited in any products generated from this data. The following source citation should be included: BEDROCK_GEOLOGY_RGM_250K_IN: Bedrock geology of Indiana, from the Regional Geologic Map Series of the Indiana Geological Survey (Indiana Geological Survey, 1:250,000, Polygon Shapefile), compiled by A.M. Burger, N.K. Bleuer, J.L. Forsyth, A.M Gooding, H.H. Gray, J.R. Hill, G.H. Johnson, S.J. Keller, J.A. Lineback, R.S. Nicoll, A.F. Schneider, W.J. Wayne, and C.E. Wier, digital compilation by A.R. Gustin, 2013.
WARRANTY
Indiana University, Indiana Geological Survey warrants that the media on which this product is stored will be free from defect in materials and workmanship for ninety (90) days from the date of acquisition. If such a defect is found, return the media to Publication Sales, Indiana Geological Survey, 611 North Walnut Grove, Bloomington, Indiana 47405-2208, and it will be replaced free of charge.

The risk or liability resulting from the use of this product is assumed by the user. metainfo.metuc: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the IGS. It should not to be altered or summarized. IGS does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone besides the IGS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.
